recipe_name: Black spaghetti with white wine, crayfish and tomato sauce
author: Tony Tobin
method: For the crayfish stock, put the garlic, spring onions, prawn heads and shells, white wine, tomato purée, ketchup and water into a medium saucepan; place on the heat and boil for eight minutes. Strain over a bowl, reserving the stock and discarding the shells and vegetables. For the pasta sauce, pour the strained stock back into the pan, add the cream and spring onion and cook over a medium heat for two minutes. Stir in the tomato. To serve, put the spaghetti into two pasta bowls and top with the sauce.
ingredients: 1 garlic clove, peeled,  2 spring onions, finely chopped,  5 prawn heads and shells,  75ml/2½fl oz white wine,  1 tsp tomato purée,  1 tsp tomato ketchup,  100ml/3½fl oz boiling water,  125ml/4fl oz double cream,  1 spring onion, chopped,  1 tomato, chopped,  300g/10½oz black (squid ink) spaghetti, cooked according to packet instructions
